recipe.ingredients: - large apples: 4 (such as Granny Smith or Honeycrisp) - ground cinnamon: 2 teaspoons - nutmeg: 1/2 teaspoon - ground ginger: 1/2 teaspoon - fresh lemon juice: 1 tablespoon - water: 1/4 cup - chopped walnuts (optional): 1/4 cup - golden raisins (optional): 1/4 cup
recipe.directions: 1. Preheat Oven: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). 2. Prepare Apples: Core the apples and make a small well in the center. Place them in a shallow baking dish. 3. Spice Mixture: In a small bowl, mix together cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, lemon juice, walnuts, and raisins. 4. Fill Apples: Spoon the spice mixture into the center of each apple evenly. 5. Add Water: Pour water into the baking dish around the apples. 6. Bake: Cover the dish with foil and bake for 40-45 minutes, or until the apples are tender. 7. Serve: Serve warm, using the juices in the dish as a sauce over the apples.
